sentences.sContent: Red squirrels cut conifer cones from trees and bury them in plant litter on the forest floor.
sentences.sContent_eng: Red squirrels cut conifer cones from trees and bury them in plant litter on the forest floor.
sentences.sCn: 红松鼠会将针叶树上的果实割下来，然后埋在森林地面的落叶中。

sentences.sContent: To get annual temperatures, they measured rings in high-altitude conifer trees, which grow faster in warmer summers and slower in colder years.
sentences.sContent_eng: To get annual temperatures, they measured rings in high-altitude conifer trees, which grow faster in warmer summers and slower in colder years.
sentences.sCn: 为了得出每年的气温值，他们对生长在高海拔地区的针叶树的年轮进行测量，这种树木在炎烈的夏天生长得比较快，而在寒冷的年份就长得比较慢。

remMethod.val: con(=cone圆锥， 松果) + i + fer(带来) → 带来松果的树 → 针叶树

trans.tranOther: a tree such as a  pine  or  fir  that has leaves like needles and produces brown  cones  that contain seeds. Most types of conifer keep their leaves in winter.
